intro: Pectocarya chilensis var. californica, commonly known as the California pectocarya, is a perennial herb native to coastal regions of California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats along the coastline.
